frameDefinitions: A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
This frame concerns a Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a Figure within a Ground.
In this frame, an Agent engages in personal body care by grooming either a Patient or a Body_part.
This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.
This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
frameExamples: Legislator tells consumers to be <t>alert</t> to dioxin levels.
The Spaniards <t>conquered</t> the Incas with both the Cross and the arquebus
Shortly after the boy <t>surrendered</t> the gun, the three remaining warriors made a rush for liberty.
On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
listRoleDefinitions: This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The individual that pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is specifically focussing on within the <fen>Ground</fen>.
An entity (or event) associated with a <fen>Perceiver</fen> that gives evidence for a <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s attentiveness.
The agent is the person who does the grooming.
The patient is the person who gets washed.
This is the region of the body that gets groomed.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The person compelled to transfer the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes possession.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> conquered Egypt in the year 525 BC
Britain had an opportunity to conquer <fex>Europe</fex>.
China 's <fex>1997</fex> takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony
<fex>On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to conquer those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: about the middle of the ninth century
the end of the tenth (?) century
the end of the tenth century
the first half of the fifteenth century
Iscrizione Inedite di Antichi Sepolcri Giudaici del Napolitano
the second half of the tenth century
the early part of the sixteenth century
The Early Settlement of the Jews
the second half of the ninth century
